text: the moon is on average three hundred and
seventy five thousand six hundred and
forty-three kilometers away to get there
you need a ship capable of escaping the
Earth's gravity and some astronauts made
of the right stuff three thousand one
hundred and fifty men and women applied
to the astronauts for the American space
program but selection was strict but
physically and mentally
the successful apollo candidates we're
on average just under 1.8 meters tall
weighed 70 2.6 kilograms and were just
under 39 on their first flight plus they
were clever with an average IQ of 140
1/3 of the 30g serving astronauts were
selected for the first trip to the moon
amongst their luggage were medical
supplies survival gear and food supplies
including three sausage patties 12
strawberry cubes and 6 prawn cocktail
this is the sixties remember but the
biggest problem isn't the dodgy cuisine
it's escaping Earth's gravity and for a
big problem you need a big rocket the
Saturn 5 was a monster it consisted of
three stages first five f-1 engines
launch the astronauts the most powerful
of the time together they produce 160
million horsepower they burn for 165
seconds and carried the craft 68
kilometers a modern family car will
average about 65 miles per gallons five
F one's Juba 13 centimetres the second
stage takes the spacecraft a further 106
kilometers
and the third stage takes the craft into
orbit and on its way to the moon guided
by a computer with less power than your
average wristwatch the astronauts spent
eight days four hours and 35 seconds
together in a metal cap just two hours
and 32 minutes of which was actually on
the moon they splashed down in the
Pacific Ocean considerably lighter than
when they set off they arrived to a
hero's welcome and three weeks in
quarantine
